Ambassador of Sri Lanka to Slovenia Majintha Jayesinghe presented Letters of Credence in Slovenia

Ambassador of Sri Lanka to Slovenia, Majintha Jayesinghe, presented the Letters of Credence to the President of the Republic of Slovenia, Borut Pahor, at the Presidential Palace in Ljubljana, accrediting as the Ambassador. This formal ceremony solidified Jayesinghe's official role as the Sri Lankan Ambassador to Slovenia.
Foreign Ministry discusses the environmental and economic impact of the X-Express Pearl fire

The Foreign Ministry, led by Foreign Minister Dinesh Gunewardena, held a special discussion on July 1 to address the environmental and economic impact of the X-Press Pearl fire. The meeting focused on assessing the repercussions of the incident.
Communication on the impact on the working public by suspending the GSP+ facility by Trade Unions to the Foreign Minister

Trade unions have requested the Foreign Minister to address the impact on the working public if Sri Lanka loses the GSP+ facility due to resolutions passed in the European Union Parliament. Five major trade unions are concerned about how this suspension would affect the country's workforce.
Assistance is sought from the Food and Agriculture Organization (FAO) to conduct a survey on the composition of Sri Lankan soil and grant a soil card to farmers

The Food and Agriculture Organization (FAO) is assisting Sri Lanka in conducting a survey on the composition of its soil and issuing soil cards to farmers. This initiative aims to streamline the use of organic fertilizer in the country, as highlighted by the FAO.
New UNICEF Country Representative presents his Credentials to Foreign Minister
The new UNICEF Country Representative to Sri Lanka, Christian Skoog, presented his credentials to Foreign Minister Dinesh Gunawardena on July 5, 2022.
Foreign Secretary Colombage interviewed on ‘Ada Derana Get Real by Mahieash Johnney’

Foreign Secretary Admiral Prof. Jayanath Colombage was interviewed by Mahieash Johnney on Ada Derana Get Real. The discussion focused on India's concerns regarding the Port City project. The interview took place on Episode 110 on July 5, 2021.
Foreign Minister Dinesh Gunawardena virtually interacts with Sri Lankan expats in Singapore and Brunei Darussalam

Foreign Minister Dinesh Gunawardena virtually engaged with Sri Lankan expats in Singapore and Brunei Darussalam, including community and business associations, the Maha Sangha, and religious leaders. The interaction was productive and aimed at fostering connections with overseas Sri Lankans.
Sri Lanka informs EU of action to review PTA and on progress in reconciliation

Sri Lanka has informed the European Union about its actions to review the Prevention of Terrorism Act (PTA) and the progress made in reconciliation efforts. The update was provided by the Government of Sri Lanka during its routine engagement and dialogue with the EU through the Foreign Ministry.
New FAO Country Representative calls on the Foreign Minister

The newly appointed Country Representative of the Food and Agriculture Organization (FAO) to Sri Lanka, Vimlendra Sharan, met with Foreign Minister Dinesh Gunawardena at the Foreign Ministry on June 28, 2021. The meeting aimed to strengthen cooperation between FAO and Sri Lanka in the field of food and agriculture.
Foreign Minister meets the new WHO Representative to Sri Lanka

Foreign Minister Dinesh Gunawardena welcomed Dr. Alaka Singh, the new WHO Representative to Sri Lanka, during a meeting at the Ministry today (25 June). The meeting aimed to strengthen collaboration between Sri Lanka and the WHO.
Statement by Foreign Minister Dinesh Gunawardena, at the NIICE Global Conclave 2021,  25 June, 2021

Foreign Minister Dinesh Gunawardena expressed gratitude to the Nepal Institute for International Cooperation and Engagement (NIICE) for inviting him to address the Inaugural Session at the NIICE Global Conclave 2021 on June 25, 2021.
Foreign Minister Dinesh Gunawardena attends the Asia-Pacific High Level Conference on Belt and Road Cooperation

Foreign Minister Dinesh Gunawardena participated in the Asia-Pacific High Level Conference on Belt and Road Cooperation on June 23, 2021, emphasizing the need for increased cooperation among states and other participants. The conference was held virtually.
India and Sri Lanka agree to co-operate on common issues in the region

India and Sri Lanka have agreed to cooperate on common regional issues. During a telephone conversation, Foreign Minister Dinesh Gunawardena and Indian External Affairs Minister discussed steps taken to enhance bilateral relations. The two countries aim to strengthen their ties for mutual benefit.
Ambassador of Sri Lanka to Kazakhstan Prof. M.D. Lamawansa presents credentials to Kazakhstan President

Ambassador of Sri Lanka to Kazakhstan Prof. M.D. Lamawansa presented his Letters of Credence to Kazakhstan President Kassym-Jomart Tokayev at a ceremony held at Acorda Presidentia. The event marked the official recognition of Lamawansa as Sri Lanka's representative to Kazakhstan.
Procument Notice – Ministry of Agriculture Sri Lanka

The Ministry of Agriculture in Sri Lanka has issued a procurement notice for the importation of organic fertilizer and natural minerals (Potassium Chloride) for paddy cultivation. This pre-qualification document is under the State Ministry of Production, Supply, and Regulation of Organic and Natural Fertilizer. Interested parties should take note of this opportunity for agricultural support.
The General Administration Customs of China (GACC) approves the Health Certificate for importing fisheries products to China

The General Administration of Customs of China (GACC) has approved the Health Certificate for importing fisheries products to China. This approval allows the entry of approved fisheries and aquatic products into the lucrative Chinese market.
State Ministry of Regional Cooperation facilitates collaboration on Graphene applications with Russian Company

The State Ministry of Regional Cooperation is facilitating collaboration on Graphene applications with a Russian company to harness Sri Lanka's natural resources for economic growth. This initiative aims to explore sustainable ways for the country's development.
Foreign Ministry hosts stakeholder meeting to brief foreign experts  on the MV-X Press Pearl Disaster

The European Union (EU)/ECHO, through the United Nations Environment Programme (UNEP), supports three technical experts to assist the Sri Lankan Government in assessing the impact of the MV-X Press Pearl Disaster. The experts were briefed during a stakeholder meeting hosted by the Foreign Ministry.
Foreign Minister Dinesh Gunawardena and U.K. Minister for South Asia, Lord Ahmad discuss steps to enhance bilateral cooperation

Foreign Minister Dinesh Gunawardena and UK Minister for South Asia, Lord Tariq Ahmad discussed enhancing bilateral cooperation during a video call on Thursday, June 17. Both ministers agreed to explore opportunities to strengthen ties between their countries.
The Korean Ambassador to Sri Lanka assures that the prospect to leave for work in Korea will be provided shortly

The Korean Ambassador to Sri Lanka, Woonjin Jeong, assured the Foreign Minister that necessary facilities for eligible Sri Lankan youth to work in Korea will be provided soon. This initiative aims to facilitate their travel and employment opportunities in Korea.
Compensation, salary dues and other redress to the family members of  deceased Sri Lankan migrant workers overseas

The Consular Affairs Division of the Foreign Ministry held a ceremony at the Ministry Premises to provide compensation, salary dues, and other redress to the families of deceased Sri Lankan migrant workers abroad. Letters of compensation were handed over to the respective family members during the event.
Sri Lanka’s Observations on the Resolution adopted in the EU Parliament

Sri Lanka's Foreign Ministry expressed regret over the resolution adopted in the European Parliament on June 10, 2021, titled "The Situation in Sri Lanka." The resolution addressed concerns about arrests made under the Prevention of Terrorism Act.
State Minister Balasuriya calls for Indian Investors to join Sri Lanka in pursuit of ‘Shared Prosperity’

State Minister for Regional Cooperation Tharaka Balasuriya has called on Indian investors to join Sri Lanka in pursuing 'shared prosperity' by investing in the country. The minister emphasized the opportunity for both nations to benefit from this partnership.
Foreign Minister Gunawardena conveys appreciation to Australian counterpart for support to Sri Lanka
Foreign Minister Dinesh Gunawardena expressed appreciation to Australian counterpart Marise Payne for their support to Sri Lanka in a recent telephone conversation on Wednesday.
Sri Lanka and Ethiopia discuss enhancement of political and economic ties at first ever bilateral consultations

Sri Lanka and Ethiopia engaged in their first-ever bilateral consultations at the Foreign Ministry level on June 9, 2021. The discussions focused on enhancing political and economic ties between the two countries. Foreign Minister Dinesh Gunaratne represented Sri Lanka during the virtual meeting.
Foreign Minister Gunawardena appreciates Russia’s support to Sri Lanka in conversation with Foreign Minister Lavrov

Foreign Minister Dinesh Gunawardena expressed deep appreciation to Russian Foreign Minister Sergey Lavrov for Russia's support to Sri Lanka during a telephone conversation on June 7, 2021. Gunawardena highlighted the importance of the support extended by Russia.
Congratulatory Message extended by Foreign Minister Hon. Dinesh Gunawardena to Minister of Foreign Affairs of the Republic of Maldives Hon. Abdulla Shahid

Foreign Minister Hon. Dinesh Gunawardena extended a congratulatory message to Minister of Foreign Affairs of the Republic of Maldives Hon. Abdulla Shahid. The message conveyed warm wishes and a commitment to strengthen bilateral relations between the two countries.
US Chargé d’ Affaires calls on the Foreign Minister

US Chargé d’Affaires a.i. Martin T. Kelly visited Foreign Minister Dinesh Gunawardena at the Foreign Ministry in Colombo on June 8, 2021. During the meeting, the Foreign Minister expressed gratitude to the government and people of the US.
BIMSTEC Day message of Hon Foreign Minister Dinesh Gunawardena

Honorable Foreign Minister Dinesh Gunawardena delivered a message on BIMSTEC Day. The message was conveyed in multiple languages, including English, Sinhala, and Tamil, emphasizing the importance of regional cooperation.
Sri Lanka calls on US House Foreign Affairs Committee not to proceed with resolution on Sri Lanka

Sri Lanka's Ambassador in Washington, Ravinatha Aryasinha, has formally requested the US House Foreign Affairs Committee not to proceed with Resolution H. RES. 413 on Sri Lanka, introduced by Congresswoman Deborah Ross. Sri Lanka urges the committee to reconsider the resolution.
Sri Lanka Deputy High Commissioner-designate to Deputy High Commissioner of Sri Lanka in Chennai-India assumed duties

Dr. Doraisamy Venkateshwaran has officially assumed duties as the Deputy High Commissioner of Sri Lanka in Chennai, India on April 12, 2021. He will be representing the Democratic Socialist Republic of Sri Lanka in South India.
Statement on the Resolution introduced by the US House of Representatives
The Foreign Ministry acknowledges Resolution No. H.RES.413 introduced in the US House of Representatives by Representative Deborah K. Ross on May 18, 2021, along with four other Representatives.
Virtual meeting between Foreign Minister Dinesh Gunawardena and Minister of State of United Arab Emirates Ahamed Ali Al Sayegh

Sri Lankan Foreign Minister Dinesh Gunawardena and UAE Minister of State Ahamed Ali Al Sayegh held a virtual meeting on May 31, 2021. The discussion likely focused on bilateral relations and cooperation between the two countries.
Permanent Missions of Sri Lanka and Thailand to the United Nations co-host a virtual commemoration for International Day of Vesak

The Permanent Missions of Sri Lanka and Thailand co-hosted a virtual commemoration for the International Day of Vesak at the United Nations on May 25, 2021. This event celebrated the occasion with various activities and discussions.
Message of Foreign Minister Dinesh Gunawardena at the commemoration of the International Day of Vesak

Foreign Minister Dinesh Gunawardena delivered a message at the virtual commemoration of the International Day of Vesak hosted by the United Nations in Sri Lanka on May 26, 2021. The event was also attended by the Foreign Ministry and other Member States in Colombo.
The message of Hon. Dinesh Gunawardena, Foreign Minister of Sri Lanka for Vesak Day 2021

Foreign Minister of Sri Lanka, Hon. Dinesh Gunawardena, delivered a message for Vesak Day 2021. The message emphasized the significance of Vesak and its teachings for peace and harmony. Gunawardena highlighted the importance of compassion and understanding in fostering unity among all communities.
The message of H.E. Gotabaya Rajapaksa President of Sri Lanka for Vesak Day 2021
Sri Lankan President Gotabaya Rajapaksa delivered messages in English, Sinhala, and Tamil for Vesak Day 2021. The messages were shared to commemorate the occasion and convey his wishes to the people.
The video message (English) of Hon.Mahinda Rajapaksa Prime Minister of Sri Lanka for Vesak Day 2021

Hon. Mahinda Rajapaksa, the Prime Minister of Sri Lanka, has released a video message in English for Vesak Day 2021. The video can be downloaded from the following link: https://wetransfer.com/downloads/0b25d673fdd1e9f7551990bfd76e93.
Foreign Ministry organizes several special Vesak programmes

The Foreign Ministry, led by Foreign Minister Dinesh Gunawardena and Foreign Secretary Admiral Prof. Jayanath Colombage, has organized special religious programmes to mark the Vesak Festival this year. The initiatives aim to celebrate Vesak and promote cultural understanding.
Open Competitive Examination for Recruitment to Grade III of the Sri Lanka Foreign Service – 2020 (2021)

The Foreign Ministry announced amendments to the Gazette notification for the Open Competitive Examination for Grade III of the Sri Lanka Foreign Service – 2020 (2021). The Public Service Commission has approved changes to the advertising section. Interested candidates should review the updated requirements for the examination.
Suspension of all inbound passenger arrival to Sri Lanka
Sri Lanka will suspend all inbound passenger arrivals.
The last batch of detained Sri Lankan migrant workers in Saudi Arabia returns to Sri Lanka
The repatriation of Sri Lankan migrant workers detained in Riyadh and Jeddah has concluded, with the last batch of 103 detainees returning to Sri Lanka on Saudi Airlines SV 786 on 19 May.
Foreign Minister Dinesh Gunawardena meets EU Ambassadors in Colombo
Foreign Minister Dinesh Gunawardena met with EU Ambassadors in Colombo on Tuesday, May 18, 2021. They discussed mutual interests, including EU-Sri Lanka cooperation, at the Foreign Ministry.
State Ministry of Regional Cooperation launches Creative Economy Programme

The State Ministry of Regional Cooperation has launched the Creative Economy Programme to boost the country's economy and showcase Sri Lanka's cultural heritage. The initiative aims to promote the creative economy sector and support local artists and entrepreneurs.
Sri Lanka concerned over escalating violence between Palestine and Israel

Sri Lanka is deeply concerned about the increasing violence between Palestine and Israel. The Foreign Minister recently expressed this concern to the Ambassador of Palestine in Sri Lanka, emphasizing the seriousness of the situation.
The message of H.E. Gotabaya Rajapaksa, President of Sri Lanka on the occasion of Ramazan

President of Sri Lanka, H.E. Gotabaya Rajapaksa, has conveyed his message on the occasion of Ramazan in English, Sinhala, and Tamil versions. The message aims to reach a diverse audience and promote unity during this important religious period.
Sri Lanka Consulate General Office in Milan moves to new premises

The Consulate General of Sri Lanka in Milan, Italy is relocating to new premises at Via Giovanni da Udine, n. 15, 20156, Milan on May 18, 2021. This move aims to offer improved facilities for the Sri Lankan community in the area.
Sri Lanka opposes Bill 104 of Ontario Legislative Assembly

Sri Lanka's Foreign Minister Dinesh Gunawardena expressed deep concerns to Canadian High Commissioner David McKinnon about Ontario Legislative Assembly's Bill 104. The Sri Lankan government opposes the passing of this Private Member's Bill.
Foreign Ministry hosts webinar to review measures of Port State Control and Maritime Safety and Security in the Indian Ocean Region

The Foreign Ministry hosted a webinar to review Port State Control measures and Maritime Safety and Security in the Indian Ocean Region. The event featured international legal experts, including Prof. Rüdiger Wolfrum and the Director of the Norwegian Centre for the Law of the Sea. The webinar aimed to enhance cooperation and compliance in maritime regulations for the region.
High Commissioner Kananathan presents Credentials in Uganda
High Commissioner Veluppillai Kananathan presented his Letter of Credence appointing him as the High Commissioner of Sri Lanka to Uganda, with residence in Kenya, to President Yoweri Kaguta Museveni.
Statement on Saudi Arabia’s Saudi Green and Middle East Green Initiatives

Sri Lanka congratulates Saudi Arabia on its Saudi Green and Middle East Green Initiatives, aimed at fostering regional cooperation to address environmental challenges in Saudi Arabia and the broader region.
Sri Lanka condemns the terrorist attack on Speaker of the Maldivian Parliament and former President of Maldives Hon. Mohamed Nasheed

Sri Lanka has condemned the terrorist attack on Hon. Mohamed Nasheed, the Speaker of the Maldivian Parliament and former President of Maldives, on May 6, 2021. The government and people stand united against such acts of violence.
The Sixteenth Informal Meeting of the SAARC Finance Ministers

The Sixteenth Informal Meeting of the SAARC Finance Ministers took place virtually on May 5, 2021, from 1:30 PM to 3:30 PM (Manila Time). The meeting was held alongside the 54th Annual Meeting of the Asian Development Bank (ADB).
Ambassador of Sri Lanka presents credentials to the Netherlands based Organization for the Prohibition of Chemical Weapons (OPCW)

Ambassador Aruni Ranaraja of Sri Lanka presented her credentials to Dr. Fernando Arias, the Director General of the Organization for the Prohibition of Chemical Weapons (OPCW) in the Netherlands. She is now the Permanent Representative of Sri Lanka to the OPCW, strengthening diplomatic ties between the two countries.
The UK and Sri Lanka lead on ‘Nitrogen for Climate and Green Recovery’  27 – 29 April 2021, Colombo

The UK and Sri Lanka co-hosted a virtual event titled "Nitrogen for Climate and Green Recovery" from April 27 to 29, 2021, in Colombo. The event was organized by the British High Commission in Colombo and the Government of the Democratic Socialist Republic of Sri Lanka, focusing on environmental initiatives.
Limited Services provided by the Consular Affairs Division

The Consular Affairs Division of the Foreign Ministry has adjusted its operating hours to 7.30 a.m. to 1.00 p.m. in compliance with recent health authority guidelines amid the ongoing COVID-19 situation. Please note the limited services available during this time.
Country Director of the World Food Programme (WFP) to Sri Lanka Abdur Rahim Siddiqui presents his credentials to Foreign Minister Dinesh Gunawardena

Abdur Rahim Siddiqui, the Country Director of the World Food Programme (WFP) in Sri Lanka, presented his credentials to Foreign Minister Dinesh Gunawardena on May 3, 2021, at the Foreign Ministry. The Foreign Minister accepted the credentials during the official ceremony.
Sri Lanka strongly condemns the terror attack on civilians in Pul-e-Alam city in Afghanistan

Sri Lanka has strongly condemned the terror attack on civilians that occurred on April 30, 2021, in Pul-e-Alam city, Logar Province, Afghanistan. The attack targeted civilians, including students and children, in an act of indiscriminate violence.
The Message of H.E. Gotabaya Rajapaksa, President of Sri Lanka, on May Day
President of Sri Lanka, H.E. Gotabaya Rajapaksa, delivered a May Day message available in English, Sinhala, and Tamil versions.
Statement of His Excellency Gotabaya Rajapaksa, President of Sri Lanka  read by Honourable Dinesh Gunawardena, Foreign Minister

His Excellency Gotabaya Rajapaksa, President of Sri Lanka's statement for the Pre-COP26 virtual event on Nitrogen for Climate and Green Recovery was read by Foreign Minister Dinesh Gunawardena in Colombo on 27-29 April 2021. In his address, President Rajapaksa expressed great pleasure in speaking to the distinguished participants about the importance of the event.
The first group of Sri Lankans held at the ‘Tarheel’ deportation camp in Riyadh to return to Sri Lanka tomorrow

The first group of Sri Lankans held at the 'Tarheel' deportation camp in Riyadh, Saudi Arabia, will return to Sri Lanka on Friday (30). Subsequent groups will also be returning to Sri Lanka in the following days.
Limited Services provided by the Consular Affairs Division

The Consular Affairs Division of the Foreign Ministry is currently offering limited services to prioritize the health and safety of visitors amid the ongoing COVID-19 situation and recent health guidelines. Please be advised of the reduced service availability during this time.
Sri Lanka participates in a region-wide activity to consolidate joint COVID-19 cooperation

Sri Lanka's Foreign Minister Dinesh Gunawardena joined a video conference today with counterparts from China, Afghanistan, Bangladesh, Nepal, and Pakistan to discuss joint COVID-19 cooperation. The meeting aimed to strengthen collaboration in response to the pandemic.
Sri Lanka Ambassador to the Kingdom of the Netherlands, presents Letters of Credence to Majesty the King of the Netherlands

Sri Lanka's new Ambassador to the Kingdom of the Netherlands, Aruni Ranaraja, presented her credentials to King Willem-Alexander at the Royal Palace in The Hague on April 21, 2021. The ceremony marked the official start of her diplomatic mission in the Netherlands.
High Commissioner Srimal Wickremasinghe presents Credentials to the President of the Seychelles

High Commissioner Srimal Wickremasinghe presented his Letters of Credence to the President of the Republic of Seychelles on April 20, 2021, at a ceremony held at the State House. The event was attended by the Minister o.
Speech by Foreign Minister Dinesh Gunawardena at Stakeholder Dialogue on Climate Change, Resilience & Just Recovery in the Sectors of Agriculture, Forestry & Biodiversity

Foreign Minister Dinesh Gunawardena expressed gratitude to SLYCAN Trust and stakeholders for the invitation to speak at the Stakeholder Dialogue on Climate Change, Resilience & Just Recovery in Agriculture, Forestry & Biodiversity. The event aimed to address crucial issues in these sectors for a sustainable future.
Sri Lankan fishermen arrested in Myanmar will return to Sri Lanka tomorrow

The 12 Sri Lankan fishermen arrested in Myanmar will return to Sri Lanka tomorrow after the Foreign Ministry facilitated their repatriation. The fishermen were released following several rounds of talks with the Myanmar government.
Presentation of Credentials to the Director General of UNESCO by the Ambassador Prof.  Kshanika Hirimburegama

Ambassador Prof. Kshanika Hirimburegama presented her credentials to UNESCO Director General Audrey Azoulay at a ceremony in Paris on April 16, 2021. She assumed the role as Sri Lanka's Permanent Representative.
Ambassador Prof. Kshanika Hirimburegama presented Credentials to President of France Emmanuel Macron

Ambassador Prof. Kshanika Hirimburegama presented her credentials to President Emmanuel Macron on April 12, 2021, at the Elysee Palace in Paris. During the ceremony, President Macron encouraged all the Ambassadors.
High Commissioner S. Amarasekara presents Credentials to President of South Africa Cyril Ramaphosa
High Commissioner S. Amarasekara presented his Letters of Credence to President Cyril Ramaphosa of South Africa on April 14, 2021, at the Sefako M Makgatho Presidential Guest House in Pretoria.
Virtual Address by H.E. the President of Sri Lanka at the BOAO Forum for Asia 2021
President of Sri Lanka delivered a virtual address at the BOAO Forum for Asia 2021. The speech took place on April 20, 2021, addressing key issues at the forum.
Dr. Palitha Kohona presents Credentials to the Chinese President

Ambassador Dr. Palitha Kohona presented his Letters of Credence to Chinese President Xi Jinping on April 14, 2021, at the Great Hall of the People in Beijing. This formal exchange signifies the official start of his diplomatic role representing his country in China.
Sinhala and Tamil New Year message of  President Gotabaya Rajapaksa

President Gotabaya Rajapaksa has conveyed his Sinhala and Tamil New Year message to the nation, emphasizing unity and prosperity. The message was delivered in both Sinhala and Tamil languages to reach a wider audience and promote cultural harmony.
Foreign Secretary Admiral Prof. Jayanath Colombage’s Interview on “CGTN Dialogue” – 12 April 2021

Foreign Secretary Admiral Prof. Jayanath Colombage discussed Sri Lanka's COVID-19 situation, post-pandemic economic revival, and vaccination program during an interview on "CGTN Dialogue" on 12 April 2021.
Special Representative of Prime Minister Mahinda Rajapaksa visits Oman
Special Representative of Sri Lankan Prime Minister Mahinda Rajapaksa, State Minister of Finance Ajith Nivard Cabraal, visited Oman from April 7 to 10, 2021.
Foreign Minister signs the Book of Condolence

Foreign Minister Dinesh Gunawardena signed the Book of Condolence for the passing of His Royal Highness the Prince Philip, Duke of Edinburgh on behalf of President Gotabaya Rajapaksa and the Government.
Foreign Minister Dinesh Gunawardena discusses EU-Sri Lanka cooperation with EU Ambassadors in Colombo

Foreign Minister Dinesh Gunawardena met with EU Ambassadors in Colombo on Friday to discuss cooperation between the EU and Sri Lanka. The meeting took place at the Foreign Ministry, where Gunawardena briefed them on political and economic developments.
Gazette notification to recruit 40 eligible candidates to join the Sri Lanka Foreign Service (SLFS)

The Foreign Ministry has announced a gazette notification for the recruitment of 40 eligible candidates to join the Sri Lanka Foreign Service (SLFS). The Gazette Notification No. 2,223 dated 9 is now published, inviting qualified individuals to apply for the positions. Interested candidates can find in the official notification.
Sri Lanka and New Zealand inaugurate Foreign Ministry Consultations

Sri Lanka and New Zealand inaugurated their First Round of Foreign Ministry Consultations virtually on 08 April 2021. The meeting was co-chaired by the Acting Director General of the East Asia Division of the Foreign Ministry. This initiative aims to strengthen diplomatic ties between the two countries.
Sri Lanka and Afghanistan sign MoU on Establishment of a Political Consultations Mechanism between Foreign Ministry of Sri Lanka and the Ministry of Foreign Affairs of Afghanistan

Sri Lanka and Afghanistan signed a Memorandum of Understanding (MoU) today to establish a Political Consultations Mechanism between their respective Foreign Ministries. This agreement aims to enhance diplomatic cooperation and communication between the two countries.
Entry Requirement for Sri Lankans Lifted

Sri Lankan entry requirements have been lifted following a review by the Foreign Ministry under President Gotabaya Rajapaksa's directive on April 6, 2021. This change aims to provide relief for prospective Lankan returnees, making it easier for them to enter the country.
Sri Lanka Embassy in Oman repatriates another group of 248 stranded Sri Lankan Migrant Workers back home

The Sri Lanka Embassy in Oman, in collaboration with the President's Secretariat and the Foreign Ministry of Sri Lanka, facilitated the repatriation of 248 stranded Sri Lankan migrant workers from Muscat. The special arrangements ensured their safe return home.
The 5th Evacuation Flight from Lebanon 31 March 2021

On March 31, 2021, the Embassy of Sri Lanka in Lebanon, in partnership with the Presidential Secretariat, Foreign Ministry, and Sri Lankan Airlines, successfully repatriated 175 Sri Lankans, including 4 children, on the 5th evacuation flight from Lebanon.
Easter Sunday Message of President Gotabaya Rajapaksa
President Gotabaya Rajapaksa delivered an Easter Sunday message in English. The message aimed to convey his wishes for a peaceful and prosperous future for all citizens.
The Chinese and Russian Ambassadors call on the Foreign Minister

Foreign Minister Dinesh Gunawardena met with the Russian Ambassador Yuri Meteriy and Chinese Ambassador Qi Zhenhong at the Foreign Ministry last Wednesday. The ambassadors discussed matters of mutual interest and cooperation with the Sri Lankan government.
Foreign Minister Dinesh Gunawardena elected to chair the 17th Session of the Ministerial Meeting of BIMSTEC

Sri Lanka's Foreign Minister Dinesh Gunawardena has been elected to chair the 17th Session of the Ministerial Meeting of BIMSTEC, the Bay of Bengal Initiative for Multi-Sectoral Technical and Economic Cooperation. Gunawardena will lead the discussions at the upcoming meeting as the appointed chair.
State Minister of Regional Cooperation meets Chinese Ambassador at Foreign Ministry

State Minister of Regional Cooperation Tharaka Balasuriya met with the Chinese Ambassador HE Qi Zhenhong at the Foreign Ministry on April 1, 2021. The meeting was a courtesy call to discuss cooperation between the two countries.
Foreign Minister calls for early conclusion of Charter of the Association of BIMSTEC Speakers and Parliamentarians at the 17th BIMSTEC Ministerial Meeting

Foreign Minister Dinesh Gunawardena urged for the prompt finalization of the Charter of the Association of BIMSTEC Speakers and Parliamentarians during his welcome speech at the 17th BIMSTEC Ministerial Meeting.
Appointment of the Ambassador of the Socialist Republic of Viet Nam to Sri Lanka

The Government of the Socialist Republic of Viet Nam, with the approval of the Government of Sri Lanka, has appointed Mrs. Ho Thi Thanh Truc as the Ambassador Extraordinary and Plenipotentiary to Sri Lanka. Mrs. Truc will represent Viet Nam in her new diplomatic role in Sri Lanka.
Interview of the Foreign Secretary on Hydepark of Ada Derana – 27 March 2021

Foreign Secretary Admiral Prof. Jayanath Colombage discussed the recent UNHRC draft resolution on Sri Lanka and the country's future direction in an interview on Hydepark of Ada Derana on March 27, 2021. The interview provided insights into Sri Lanka's response to the resolution and its strategic plans moving forward.
Sri Lanka’s Envoy to the Kingdom of Sweden presents credentials

Ambassador Dharshana M. Perera has presented his credentials as Sri Lanka’s Envoy to the Kingdom of Sweden to His Majesty King Carl XVI Gustaf through a special arrangement with the Protocol Department.
Leading the IORA Maritime Safety and Security Working Group, Sri Lanka finalizes the second Work Plan for 2022 to 2026

Sri Lanka, leading the IORA Maritime Safety and Security Working Group, finalized the second Work Plan for 2022 to 2026 during the 2nd Meeting of the IORA Working Group on Maritime Safety and Security held virtually on March 18-19, 2021. Delegates representing the Indian Ocean region participated in the meeting.
Foreign Minister Gunawardena appreciates support of countries at UNHRC

Foreign Minister Dinesh Gunawardena briefed the media today on the outcome of the UNHRC sessions in Geneva, expressing appreciation for the support received from various countries. The media conference held at the Foreign Ministry highlighted the importance of international backing in addressing key issues.
Foreign Minister Dinesh Gunawardena meets CDA of Romania to review bilateral cooperation

Foreign Minister Dinesh Gunawardena met with Romania's Chargé d’Affaires, Ambassador Victor Chiujdea, to review bilateral cooperation at the Foreign Ministry in Colombo on Friday, 19 March. The discussions focused on enhancing collaboration between the two countries.
Foreign Minister Dinesh Gunawardena meets Afghanistan Ambassador to discuss bilateral issues

Foreign Minister Dinesh Gunawardena met with Afghanistan Ambassador Ashraf Haidari in Sri Lanka on March 19, 2021, at the Foreign Ministry to discuss bilateral issues. During the meeting, Ambassador Haidari provided a briefing on key matters of mutual interest.
Foreign Secretary’s Interview on CNN-News18, India – 18 March 2021

Foreign Secretary Admiral Prof. Jayanath Colombage was interviewed on CNN-News18, India on 18 March 2021. The interview can be viewed at the following links: https://t.co/U2puy4BA2D. He discussed important topics during the interview.
Joint Communique  On the State Visit of H. E. Mahinda Rajapaksa, Prime Minister of the Democratic Socialist Republic of Sri Lanka to the People’s Republic of Bangladesh on 19 – 20 March 2021
During the State Visit on 19-20 March 2021, H. E. Mahinda Rajapaksa, Prime Minister of Sri Lanka, visited Bangladesh at the invitation of H. E. Sheikh Hasina, Prime Minister.
The UK High Court quashes the judgement of the Westminster Magistrates’ Court against former Minister Counsellor (Defence) of the Sri Lanka High Commission in London Major Gen Priyanka Fernando

The UK High Court has overturned the judgement of the Westminster Magistrates’ Court against Major Gen Priyanka Fernando, the former Minister Counsellor (Defence) of the Sri Lanka High Commission in London. The appeal made by Major Gen Priyanka Fernando was successful, resulting in the quashing of the previous ruling.
Allegations made against us at the Geneva Human Rights Council are politically biased  – Foreign Minister Dinesh Gunawardena

Foreign Minister Dinesh Gunawardena has stated that the allegations of human rights abuses in Sri Lanka at the Geneva Human Rights Council are politically biased, with countries like the UK, Canada, and Germany using them for political motives. Gunawardena believes these actions are aimed at concealing the truth.

Opening Remarks by Admiral Professor Jayanath Colombage, Foreign Secretary, on the occasion of the  Second Meeting of the IORA Working Group on Maritime Safety and Security Colombo, Sri Lanka,  18th March 2021

Admiral Professor Jayanath Colombage, Foreign Secretary, delivered opening remarks at the Second Meeting of the IORA Working Group on Maritime Safety and Security in Colombo, Sri Lanka on March 18, 2021. Attendees included Hannah Singer, the U.N. Resident Coordinator in Colombo, and Dr. Gatot H. Gunawan, Acting Secretary General of IORA, along with members of the Diplomatic Corps.
Handing over the cheque of Compensation to the Next of Kin of late Mr. K P Manjula Antony

Foreign Minister Dinesh Gunawardena presented a compensation cheque of SLRs. 2,653,125.00 to the spouse of late Mr. K P Manjula Antony on March 16, 2021, at the Foreign Ministry premises. The compensation was handed over as a gesture of support to the next of kin.
Foreign Minister Dinesh Gunawardena meets with Pakistan High Commissioner in Colombo

Foreign Minister Dinesh Gunawardena met with Pakistan High Commissioner Major General (Retd.) Muhammad Saad Khattak on March 16, 2021, at the Foreign Ministry in Colombo. The meeting aimed to enhance bilateral relations between the two countries.
Media Statement of the Foreign Ministry-16 March 2021

Ambassador of Sri Lanka to Viet Nam, Prasanna Gamage, held a meeting with Vice President and General Director of Viet Nam Chamber of Commerce & Industry (VCCI), Vo Tan Thanh, at the VCCI Headquarters in Ho Chi Minh City (HCMC).
Dr. Palitha T. B. Kohona presents copy of the credentials to the Director General of the Department of Protocol of the Ministry of Foreign Affairs of China

Ambassador of Sri Lanka to China, Dr. Palitha T. B. Kohona, formally presented his credentials to Hong Lei, the Director General of the Department of Protocol at the Ministry of Foreign Affairs of China. This gesture follows protocol and strengthens diplomatic relations between the two countries.
The High Commissioner – designate to South Africa Sirisena Amarasekara Meets the Honorary Consuls in Five Neighboring Countries

The High Commissioner-designate of Sri Lanka to South Africa, Sirisena Amarasekara, held a virtual meeting with Honorary Consuls from five neighboring countries on December 10, 2020. The meeting was organized by the High Commission of Sri Lanka in Pretoria to discuss diplomatic matters and strengthen ties in the region.
Ambassador Dr. Palitha T.B. Kohona Visits Great Wall Industry Corporation

Ambassador of Sri Lanka Dr. Palitha T.B. Kohona visited China's Great Wall Industry Corporation on January 5, 2021, at the invitation of the Corporation's President, Guo Zhaoping. During the visit, the Sri Lankan delegation engaged in productive discussions.
Sri Lankan envoys to South India meet with industry professionals to seek business opportunities for bolstering the economy

Sri Lankan envoys to South India held a business interaction session with industry professionals in Chennai to explore business opportunities for boosting the economy. The session included professionals from legal, film, and investment sectors.
Sri Lanka’s boat manufacturing capabilities highlighted in Jordan

Sri Lanka's boat manufacturing capabilities were highlighted in Jordan during a virtual meeting organized by the Embassy of Sri Lanka in Jordan and the Sri Lanka Export Development Board on January 6, 2021. The meeting aimed to showcase Sri Lanka's highly specialized boat manufacturing expertise.
Virtual meeting with the Officials of the Aviation and the Sri Lanka Tourism Promotion Bureau

Ambassador Dr. Nalin de Silva conducted a virtual meeting with officials from the Ministry of Tourism and Aviation and the Sri Lanka Tourism Promotion Bureau. The discussion focused on strategies to enhance tourism promotion between the two countries.
Sri Lanka Ambassador-Designate to Japan assumed duties

Sri Lanka's Ambassador-Designate to Japan, Sanjiv Gunasekara, officially began his duties in Tokyo on January 6, 2021. He is the seventeenth Sri Lankan Ambassador to Japan in the countries' 69-year bilateral relations.
Commencement of the First Working Day of the Year 2021

The Embassy of Sri Lanka in Beijing marked the first working day of 2021 by hoisting the national flag, singing the anthem, and observing a two-minute silence for national heroes. The ceremony honored those who sacrificed for the country.
The Commencement of Work Year 2021 at the Embassy of Sri Lanka in Oslo

The Embassy of Sri Lanka in Oslo started its work for 2021 with a ceremony on January 4th. Ambassador Godfrey Cooray raised the National Flag and led the singing of the National Anthem. The event marked the beginning of the new work year at the embassy.
Ceremonial Commencement of Work for the Year 2021 at the Consul General of Sri Lanka in Frankfurt

The Consulate General of Sri Lanka in Frankfurt held a special ceremony on January 4, 2021, to mark the start of the new work year, with staff participation. The program began with a ceremonial event.
Commencement of Work in the Year 2021 at the Sri Lanka High Commission in Canberra
The staff of the Sri Lanka High Commission in Canberra started work for the year 2021 with a special program on January 1st. The program began with the hoisting of the national flag at the premises.
Commencement of Work in the Year 2021

In 2021, work commenced with the hoisting of the National Flag, singing of the National Anthem, and lighting of the traditional oil lamp by High Commissioner Air Chief Marshal Ka. The event marked the beginning of the New Year with patriotic ceremonies and traditions.
World Renowned Russian Gamaleya Research Institute of Epidemiology and Microbiology holds talks with the Sri Lankan Health Authorities and Experts on Sputnik V vaccine

The World Renowned Russian Gamaleya Research Institute of Epidemiology and Microbiology engaged in discussions with Sri Lankan Health Authorities and Experts regarding the Sputnik V vaccine. The online meeting was facilitated by the Embassy, connecting the Ministries of Health from both countries for the talks.
Repatriation of Fourth Group of Sri Lankans from Lebanon on 21 December 2020

On December 21, 2020, the Embassy of Sri Lanka in Lebanon, along with the Presidential Secretariat, Foreign Ministry, and Sri Lankan Airlines, successfully repatriated a group of 271 Sri Lankans via a charter flight.
Speech by Foreign Secretary Admiral Prof. Colombage at the ‘International Conference on Business Studies (ICBR 2021)”, organized by the Faculty of Business of University of Moratuwa.

Foreign Secretary Admiral Prof. Colombage delivered a speech at the ‘International Conference on Business Studies (ICBR 2021)’ organized by the Faculty of Business of University of Moratuwa. 55th Annual Meeting of the Board of Governors in Colombo, Sri Lanka, from 2 to 5 May 2022

The Asian Development Bank (ADB) will host its 55th Annual Meeting of the Board of Governors in Colombo, Sri Lanka, from May 2 to 5, 2022. The theme for the meeting is "Positioning a climate-resilient green economy for the post COVID-19 world.

Sri Lanka as COVID-19 knowledge exchange regional hub – President proposes at UN

Sri Lanka's President proposed establishing a Regional Knowledge Hub in Colombo with the WHO to exchange COVID-19 lessons and assist countries in recovery efforts. The hub aims to support nations in building back better post-pandemic.

Statement of Lord Naseby at the Debate on the Queen’s Speech at the House of Lords, 19 May 2021

Lord Naseby welcomed the gracious Speech at the House of Lords debate on the Queen's Speech on May 19, 2021. He focused on the topic of global Britain, particularly the Indo-Pacific tilt, drawing from his personal experience of living and working in India, Pakistan, and Sri Lanka.
